message.content:
cs.HC, cs.SD, cs.CY, cs.OH, cs.LG 

The paper focuses on using Passive Infrared (PIR) motion sensors to estimate gait velocity in older adults in their own homes. This falls under the category of human-computer interaction (cs.HC) as it involves the use of technology to monitor and assess human behavior. Additionally, the paper discusses the use of Support Vector Regression (SVR) to model the relationship between transition time and gait velocity, which falls under the category of machine learning (cs.LG). The paper also discusses the advantages of this method over current approaches, which includes the fusion of location-specific information with time-stamped gait estimates, suggesting that it may fall under the categories of social and information sciences (cs.SD), cybernetics (cs.CY), and other interdisciplinary topics (cs.OH).
